main_definition: An edition refers to a specific version or print run of a published work, such as a book, magazine, newspaper, or other media.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A particular printing of a book with distinctive features
meanings_and_examples.example: The 20th edition of 'To Kill a Mockingbird' included an updated foreword by the author, Harper Lee.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An individual version or release of software or media content
meanings_and_examples.example: Version 5.1 of Microsoft Word is considered an edition of the popular word processing software.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A specific issue or printing of a magazine, newspaper, or journal
meanings_and_examples.example: The March edition of National Geographic included articles on climate change and its impacts.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An updated release of a product to address customer feedback or new market trends
meanings_and_examples.example: Apple released the iPhone 12 Pro Max as an edition, offering improved camera features compared to previous versions.
